review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Four Seasons Hotel is a superior hotel in a great location. On Market Street and close to Union Square, Ferry Terminal Building, BART/MUNI, shopping, restaurants, etc...  Our room was a deluxe view which was very spacious and provided views of the city looking across Market Street and down toward the TransAmerica building.  I was very surprised at how quiet it was both from outside noise and the hallways.  We never heard a sound and I know there were people in the next rooms.  The only downside was trying to enjoy quiet time in the lounge on Friday evening.  It was basically empty, but for a handful of people, however the music was blaring in a room off the bar. We ended up leaving and ordering drinks in our room.
review.negativeRemarks: From street level you take an elevator to the lobby and then across the lobby to another bank of elevators to the room. Inconvenient, but not terrible
review.locationRemarks: Just up the street is Westfield Mall with Bloomingdales, Nordstrom and some nice restaurants.Close to Union Square, Ferry Terminal and public transit.

review.title: Quietest hotel I've ever stayed in
review.reviewText: The room was extremely clean the hotel overall was very quiet the bar was very expensive parking was outrageously expensive but in the city I guess that's average

review.title: Hidden five star hot spot
review.reviewText: This Four seasons is full of life, hiding in the heart of San Francisco.  Four Seasons delivers privacy, fantastic food, beatific views and a cool bar.

review.title: Just okay...
review.reviewText: Staying at this particular Four Season was nothing special at all.

review.title: Nothing special
review.reviewText: Very small room for a four seasons hotel and nothing special, location and staff good but hotel has a lot to say for a hotel of this cost

review.title: Good location in DT San Francisco
review.reviewText: Took a pleasure to SF and had a delightful stay at the 4 Seasons.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators:  the set up is not convenient.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping at Union Square.

review.title: Pure luxury
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located and walking distance to most of the shopping and sights.  It's expensive but worth the price for its luxurious accommodations, large rooms and gracious staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of a thing except I wish it weren't so expensive!
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Worth Every Penny
review.reviewText: The lovely person who checked us in was fantastic. The service at the Bar/Restaurant was terrific as was room service. Loved our room and view.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing in my opinion other than perhaps have the bar menu run until midnight for folks in town attending a show/musical.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of SF, close to Union Square and shopping. Easy walk to Civic Center and SOMA. Not far from anything.

review.title: Good city location
review.reviewText: Very good city location and staff was extremely courteous and helpful

review.title: Wonderful hotel and close to everything!
review.reviewText: One word sums up this hotel, Exquisite!!!!!  The true definition of 5 star in every since of the word.

review.title: The absolute best hotel ive ever stayed.
review.reviewText: This hotel is not only five stars for the building and rooms but for the wonderful team they have that consistently exceeds expectations from Chris at guest checkin to the wonderful ladies that service the rooms.  This is a place that pays attention to the details of there guest and i can assure you we were never ever dissappointed!  If you stay here you will truly understand fove star service, and the hotel is in a great location.

review.title: Far from expectations
review.reviewText: Our room was spacious, with a large bay window and settee overlooking Market Street.  The hotel seems to have been constructed in 2000+, so the room amenities are newer.  Carpet was discolored.  No free coffee.  Bed was a bit soft.  The bathroom was expansive and functional; I did observe some shoddy workmanship on the tiles.  Water pressure was good, but no bath gels.  Robes and slippers were nice.  Wife didn't like the back alley hotel entrance, and the two-stage elevator ride to lobby then to room.  We did have breakfast at the restaurant and the staff, food, and ambiance were quite good.  Customer service and interaction with staff in general were so-so.  Did not try the Equinox sports club.  So overall, we were left wanting.  Yes, we might have gotten the more pedestrian rooms but still--you don't want your customers to think about St Regis (for next time) around the block.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was central--a block and a half to Westfield's Mall or SF MOMA.
review.negativeRemarks: Check out the Ritz for superb customer service.

review.title: Need renovation / Spa awful
review.reviewText: The hotel needs to be renovated. The spa is inside an open to the public gym and it is in awful conditions

review.title: Weekend
review.reviewText: This is the worst Four Seasons Experience I have had in my life, I will never stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: I can not think of anything
review.negativeRemarks: Improve Management
review.locationRemarks: shopping

review.title: 2 for 2
review.reviewText: Second time staying here. It's perfect. The staff is incredibly helpful and accommodating—from front desk to concierge to housekeeping. The beds are luxuriously comfortable. Breakfast in the room was well-prepared and delivered fresh and hot. We were on a high floor and the city views are thrilling. Every hotel should be what this place is. I will never stay anywhere else in San Francisco.
This is an amazing hotel in downtown San Fransisco.

review.title: Fantastic Service, Fantastic Location
review.reviewText:
The service and the location set this hotel apart. We have stayed at several Four Seasons properties in the past, and we appreciate the top-notch service provided by the staff. We were not disappointed by the SF property, at least when it comes to service. Check-in was a breeze, thanks to NaNa, who provided us with some suggestions for our stay. Service requests for extra pillows and room service were handled expertly. 

The location could not be better. You have quick access to a bunch of great restaurants nearby, along with the Metreon (if you want to see a movie), the convention center, and several museums. The Embarcadero and the Ferry Building are minutes away via Muni. 

Our only quibble with the hotel was the quality of the rooms and the decor. The rooms and public spaces felt dated. I am not sure if they have been updated since the hotel opened back in 2001. There was really nothing special about the rooms. They were clean, and functional, but not really true to the Four Seasons brand. They did not feel particularly luxurious or stylish. Also, we could hear quite a bit of noise from the hallway as well as the floor above us.

Overall, the location and service set this hotel apart from the others in San Francisco. However,  we were disappointed by the the ho-hum quality of the rooms. They do not support the $400-$500/night room rate.
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of the rooms, noise level, value.
review.locationRemarks: Metreon, Ferry Building, Museums, Convention Center, Shopping, Excellent Restaurants.

review.title: The best amenities in a hotel by far.
review.reviewText: I visit San Francisco with my wife frequently and the Four Season has become our expectation of a standard vacation.

review.title: Favorite Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: The Four Seasons surpassed our expectations.  We've stayed in many luxury hotels in SF, including the Ritz-Carlton.  Four Seasons is superior on all counts.

review.title: i requested extra towels and it not there.
review.reviewText: i had to call the front desk then they brought it.
review.positiveRemarks: it was beautiful and great city view.
review.negativeRemarks: better customer service
review.locationRemarks: it was close to everything. the location is the best in SF.

review.reviewText: Nice , we left some clothes and are hoping to get them back
Everything was intuitive. Switches were where I expected them to be. AC easy to operate. Nothing tricky or overdesigned.

review.title: Excelent Location clean and nice.
review.reviewText: It is one of the best located hotel in San Francisco and I liked it. The bed was nice and clean.  I would stay at the same hotel.
Everything was excellent except smoking? smells of room.
Boring parking. Poor parking lot. Terrible traffic. Don't go there.

review.title: Great hotel in the middle of the shopping district
review.reviewText:
If you are first time visitors to San Francisco and don't know the map, this hotel is in the best area close but not to close to Union Square. This is where everything happens. 
You can easily and nearby get on a tube, a cable car and a bus. You are in the shopping district. You have 10 blocks to the Chinese district and 15 to the North Beach (Italian district). 

The hotel is 5 stars. Period. The staff is super friendly and helpful - from the doorman who greats you every time you enter, the concierge to the reception. 

Clean, clean, clean rooms and you have access to the great gym and an Olympic size pool (we didn't use this since we were too busy). 

I will recommend this hotel anytime and go back again.

We booked this through Expedia and got a good rate. Internet was working 100% and was free of charge as well as a daily newspaper of your choice.

review.title: SF Four Seasons
review.reviewText:
Overall, a good experience but a few items which were surprising for this Four Season's reputation:
1. Hair on the bed pillows on arrival.
2. Shattered glass in the corner of the WC room (behind door).
review.positiveRemarks: Location, easy access to all transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Attention to housecleaning details (see above).
review.locationRemarks: Many shops and restaurants in the area; about a 5 min walk to Chinatown an 20 min to the piers/waterfront.

review.title: Nice hotel on Market street
review.reviewText: Our family experience was good. The location of the hotel is in the middle of downtown on Market street. The room service food was excellent, but we were a bit disappointed by the Sunday brunch. It was very simple. The hotel staff were very polite and friendly, specially during check-in and check-out and the concierge desk was very friendly and efficient.
review.negativeRemarks: Sunday brunch.
review.locationRemarks: It is right on Market street which is excellent for shopping. Don't miss riding the cable car on Powell street, but make sure you get the Red one.

review.title: Good but not four seasons quality.
review.reviewText: When we chose this hotel we expected four seasons quality. I think this one Is lower in quality but the location is really good. They need to enhance the four seasons experience

review.title: Mediocre hotel.  Not as nice as other 4-star hotel
review.reviewText: Toilet was dirty with feces on it when we checked in. Service in hotel bar was terrible. Service in hotel dining room was mediocre.
Great location! Concierge staff was so extremely helpful. Transportation was also so easy to and from airport SFO.

review.title: Very nice and clean hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful! Friendly staff, great amenities, great central location. Lived the gym!
The gym downstairs is super nice. Hotel front desk lobby has a smell, carpet is better to be cleaned. Restaurant is okish.
They are world class when it comes to the guest experience.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: perfect location. Restaurant is just what you want. Rooms are very clean with great amenities

review.title: Super friendly staff, exceptional service down to
review.reviewText: The staff was super friendly and extremely genuine.  We live in the East Bay and my wife loves the city.  This was the perfect place to stay as our weekend included dinner, the theater and shopping at Union Square.  The hotel was centrally located to all of SF's amenities.

review.title: Reasonably good hotel.
review.reviewText: Lack of  " in room facility" to prepare coffee / tea was disappointing . Restaurant menu could improve .
review.negativeRemarks: As mentioned above
review.locationRemarks: Shopping ,Chinatown ,golden gate bridge ,cable car,are all close by.

review.title: Fabulous location and fabulous service.
review.reviewText: We met with our kids and grandchildren to spend a week in SF. We love the Four Seasons and stay there as often as it is an option.  The staff and concierge service is over the top, and our rooms were lovely. It's in a great location and we were able to walk many places.
review.locationRemarks: Sn Francisco is a walkable city, and the Four Seasons is near many of the attractions. If you're a shopper, you'll love it!

review.reviewText: Room service menu is very limited. The staff doesn't seem very knowledgeable and they did nothing to anticipate our needs nor did they go out of their way to be helpful.
Asked for mutliple items from the conceirge, and they were amazing to work with

review.title: Very comfortable, quiet, well-maintained hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay in this comfortable, quiet, well-maintained hotel
Overall good experience. Facility is OK. Staff and service is exceptional.

review.title: Easy check-in and out - staff attentive
review.reviewText:
Had a great two days in San Fran - celebrated a friends birthday - champagne brought to room in timely fashion 
- tks for wonderful time
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: A perfect hotel
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful room (1614) with a great aspect.  The staff were so helpful in every way and made our 3 day stay most pleasurable.

review.title: Great Hotel! Great Staff!
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel several times and it has always been absolutely wonderful to stay there. The staff is THE best!
review.negativeRemarks: Some vegan food choices on the various menus. It's good that I will occasionally eat fish.
review.locationRemarks: The location is on Market Street and in the heart of downtown and also excellent public transportation.

review.title: Absolutely amazing
review.reviewText: The concierge staff was absolutely amazing!  They all went out of their way to make sure my time in San Francisco was the best it could possibly be.  I can't say enough positive things about them.  They all deserve a raise.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel needs updating, NOT at Four Season standards. The staff of great, extremely helpful and attentive.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall Updating... from carpets to furnitures...
review.locationRemarks: at the center of it all.

review.title: Excellent location, Fabulous staff and more!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for four nights and we couldn't have been more pleased!  Everything was perfect!  The location was excellent.  Close to everything and convenient to all types of transportation.  The staff was the best we have ever experienced.  Billy, Eric, Courtney and the Concierge staff were all very attentive, polite and took care of our requests in a pleasant manner at each interaction.  Slightly disappointed that our celebrations, birthdays and anniversary, were not recognized as we had told the staff long before our arrival.  I was hoping for a surprise for my husband but no such as we have experienced in other luxury hotels.  The accommodations were great.  Courtney helped us select the perfect room.  Bed was comfortable and the room was kept spotless by the housekeeping staff.  We will stay at Four Seasons again, no doubt!
review.positiveRemarks: The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi, coffee service in rooms
review.locationRemarks: The location was near Union Square, Ferry Building, cable car lines, MUNI lines, great restaurants, AT and T Park and fabulous shopping!

review.title: FOUR SEASON ON A FREE FALL
review.reviewText: IT Is an absolute shame there is no decent place to stay in San Francisco, the Hotel looks like a Marriott Courtyard and it is tasteless in every sense, The rooms are a cookie cutter horrible decoration, the mattress that use to be phenomenal now it is a mess, do you self a favor go to the Mandarin Oriental ask for some advise in Staff service and call Adam Tihany ask him to renew your hotel, it is an absolute shame.

review.title: Excellent hotel with great service.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with great service.We had a great time and plan to definitely return.

review.title: Perfect service, but too expensive and worn-out
review.reviewText: A bit worn out facilities, with obvious signs of long use here and there. The staff was perfect, room service - impeccable and quite fast.

The hotel was fine, but not outstanding. The service was quite good and the room was comfortable. The gym was a large facility shared with non-hotel guests who had a gym membership. The gym crowd was different from Four Seasons guests. We were charged $62/night for valet parking. I have no problem with the amount, but I would have liked to be told ahead of time. We were first charged for Internet access. But, when we informed the staff that basic Internet access is usually free in other Four Seasons hotel, they apologized and waived the charge. Finally, in the hotel restaurant I specifically asked for freshly squeezed grape fruit juiced and I was assured that the juice is freshly squeezed. To my disappointment, the juice was made out of some can or power. Not a disaster, but I would have expected more from Four Seasons.

review.title: Less about hotel but more about area in general
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel for a conference.  When I've stayed at Four Seasons I have always been wowed!  But this one was good but it was more of like a normal Marriott.  The rooms were older and we had an executive suite and it had one bath.  The bedroom was separate but there wasn't anything special.  That being said most hotels in the area were older and not as nice as I would expect.  For $1000 a night I just expect more.
The hotel was nice except for the room.  It wasn't bad, but for a Four Season's I would expect more.  It didn't even have a coffee maker in the room!

Overall, very good.
 Hotel is very nice, rooms are clean. Staff are friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice room, robes. Nice mini bar selection. We had a smoking room that smelled clean and fresh, not like stale smoke.
review.negativeRemarks: Very small ice buckets. Tub could be bigger for the price of the room.

review.title: Four Seasons in San Fco.
review.reviewText:
Great hotel.
Great staff.
Big rooms
Great bathroom (water pressure is the best)
Great GYM.
Great food (Oatmeal and juice where a great breakfast option at the rest next to the gym).
OUT OF THIS WORLD location.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, big room (for San Fco stds), great bathroom and the best location.
review.negativeRemarks: NO FREE wifi in the ROOMS.....really!!!!!

review.title: 5 star just as it is advertised
review.reviewText: Top notch. Staff is superb and every need is tended to.
review.negativeRemarks: Dining experience for breakfast could have been better

review.title: Not wroth the money you pay
review.reviewText: We spend two days in San Francisco and choose this hotel for it location and quality. We booked the hotel from expedia, for about 700 a day. When we get to hotel and find there are a lot extra charges, no breakfast included, internet access is another 18 a day, parking is about 60 a day....When we check out, the cost ends to be 1000 a day. Hotel is mediocre at best, room is small, facility is old. The only thing good is the location, it is in the center of the town right across the street to union square. Will not come back or recommend to a friend.
review.negativeRemarks: all other

review.title: Weekend in San Francisco...
review.reviewText:
Spent two nights three days at the Four Seasons. There was nothing we could have asked for that was not provided....the kids were made welcome,we had two rooms both were great.
Positioned for easy access to Union Sq,China town..... Etc.
review.positiveRemarks: The usual four seasons amenities are what I like about this hotel. Clean modern and friendly.

review.title: Excellent trip
review.reviewText: We were celebrating our 30th anniversary with a trip to San Francisco. The four seasons hotel more than met our expectations for an excellent hotel.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. I would say best hotel in San Francisco. Staff is very friendly and knowledgable.

review.title: Very convenient location
review.reviewText: Typical Four Seasons experience. Very well done. I would recommend this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very walkable location. Easy access to Embarcadero and financial district.

review.title: Great location everything near by
review.reviewText: Awesome stay for wife's birthday calibration and excellent city view o

review.title: good location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: Overall good, we had two adjoining rooms, the kids room smelled like smoke, we complained staff deodorized which solved the problem for about 24 hours then the odor returned -- then the toilet inlet valve had a slow leek which left a puddle of fresh water which I slipped in first thing in the morning. stuff happens, but really, at the Four Seasons you expect more.
review.negativeRemarks: deodorize the room
review.locationRemarks: lots to see and do near hotel

review.title: Nice, excellent
review.reviewText: Too much parking fee.
Like most Four Season hotels the service and rooms are exceptional. We requested a room on the upper floors (away from the street) and one with a view. We received both.
review.positiveRemarks: The quality of the staff, the rooms and amenities. They have a great bar and lounge that is busy and fun starting around 5:00.
review.locationRemarks: The Market Street location is reasonably located for shopping and many good restaurants. This will be our location of choice in the future.

review.positiveRemarks: Room was good size and hotel elevators were fast even though we were on a high floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Nice touch if the Four Seasons provided an in room coffee maker. Unsented toiletries, especially shampoo and conditioner would be appreciated.
review.locationRemarks: The location is convenient with excellent stores and malls all within a few blocks from the hotel.

review.title: The Four Seasons Hotel Never Disappoints!
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for my husband's birthday, which I happened to mention upon checking in. After checking in we left the hotel to do some shopping and to grab lunch. When we returned to our room we found a huge piece of chocolate cake, "Happy Birthday" written in chocolate on the plate, and fresh fruit with compliments from the hotel. What a nice surprise. The days that followed were equally as nice with an incredibly attentive staff, a spotless room (and most importantly a spotless bathroom), plush towels, and an incredibly comfortable bed. No skimping on the delicious L'Occitane soaps, shower gels and hair care products either! On our final night we decided to dine in at MKT instead of venturing out. The restaurant is closed on Sunday, but you can still order off the menu in the hotel lounge, which we did. The vibe of the lounge is amazing. So dimly lit as if by candle light with comfortable leather sofas and a blazing fireplace. The food was incredible, and again the staff was fantastic. So few hotels still live up to the standards of true luxury. Four Seasons San Francisco will not disappoint. We will be back.
review.positiveRemarks: I expect excellent service when I stay at the Four Seasons, and that is exactly what we got. The hotel is also very clean, well maintained & quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish the gym hours were the same on the weekend as they are during the week. I like the option of being able to hit the gym at 5am.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located on Market Street, which is the prime location if you are looking for great shopping. Nordstrom, Saks, Bloomingdales, etc.

review.title: San Francisco vacation
review.reviewText: Great hotel and very friendly staff! We had a wonderful stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Disappointing hotel
review.reviewText:
We were disappointed with this hotel. Great location, but they charged for EVERYTHING and the rooms were a little tired. Stayed in 4 hotels on our two week trip and this was the only one that charged for internet access.

Could do better...

review.title: Best hotel I have ever stayed in!
review.reviewText: Wonderful service, comfortable bed and well appointed room. Will be back!
review.locationRemarks: Union square, shopping, close to cable cars and great restaurants.

review.title: Service service service
review.reviewText: Four Seasons hotels have consistently given me the greatest service you can ask for in a hotel. This is the fourth or fifth one I've stayed at, and among the best. Friendly, helpful, and anticipating your needs. The hotel itself is nicely designed and our room on the top floor had city views. Facing west in San Francisco means watching incredible sunsets while the fog rolls in. Magic.
review.negativeRemarks: Honestly, it was a perfect stay. Nothing could be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Local to Union Square and all public transportation. And lots of conveniences nearby (pharmacies, etc).

review.title: Perfect Walking Distance to So Many Attractions
review.reviewText: Staying at the Four Seasons was terrific---the staff never miss an opportunity to personalize your stay. We loved the fact that we could walk out the front door and either get our day started on foot or walk a very short distance to many forms of public transportation. This hotel is in a prime spot and offers a prime stay experience!
review.positiveRemarks: The central location (especially for people who like to walk) can't be beat.

review.title: Four Seasons Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent and most pleasant choice for its location, facilities, luxurious atmosphere, food and drink in SF!
review.positiveRemarks: Loved its firm and comfortable bed and food.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Best location.

review.title: Right in the middle of everything!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay and they provided excellent service. We had a beautiful room with a view.

review.title: Excellent All-Around
review.reviewText: Just about everything about our 3 night stay was outstanding. Only complaint is the necessity to take two different elevators to get from our room to street level exit. This became annoying after a while. Otherwise, it was just about as perfect as it could get.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing since elevator situation is structural.

review.title: Perfect place
review.reviewText: Excellent staff. Very attentive to all of our requests.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was within walking distance of many attractions.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, Westfield Mall, Ferry

review.title: Excellent hotel! Great overall experience.
review.reviewText: Spacious room with good views and really comfortable beds. Conveniently located and very relaxing atmosphere.

review.title: Slippers, robes and chocolates too!
review.reviewText: Our stay was perfect from start to finish. The staff couldn't be more wonderful. The room was spacious and spotless. The little things that were provided made for an exceptional stay; water by the bed at night, excellent coffee in the early mornings down in the lobby, the heavenly deep bathtub, slippers and robes and the plate of chocolates that were delivered to our room on our last night. We have stayed at many hotels over the years, in the same general area, but the Four Seasons has won our hearts forever!
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby was removed from street and very quiet. I loved that the window could open.
review.negativeRemarks: US! We're seniors and realize it is time to get an iPhone as there are no longer "paper" guide books, phone books, etc. Time to join the 21st century
review.locationRemarks: Outstanding location. We walked everywhere- The Ferry Building, North Beach, Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf and Union Square.

review.title: Excellent weekend stay
review.reviewText:
My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons last weekend and had an excellent experience. Customer service is extremely important to me, and this hotel had the fantastic service expected of a Four Seasons-- from the doormen to the front desk to the restaurant staff. The location is conveniently on the same block as the Bart station, within walking distance to North Beach, Union Square and the Ferry Building. The rooms were well-appointed, clean, spacious, quiet, and had a "fresh" feeling to them.

Our flight was delayed upon arrival, so we missed our dinner reservation in town. We skeptically dined at the newly opened MKT restaurant in the hotel (we usually try to avoid hotel dining), and we were pleasantly surprised by delicious, creative, local and fairly priced food. Again, the service was accommodating, warm and professional.

I would stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Spectacular hotel
review.reviewText: I was shocked at the quality of service and cleanliness of the entire hotel. It was amazing. I strongly encourage anybody to stay there if they have the means. Very helpful staff and the room was kept impeccable every time we stepped away.

review.title: Exspensive alternative to plenty of nice hotels in
review.reviewText: Over expensive. No loyal card charge for every thing including e-mail. Valet parking expensive . When you play 600 per room you expect perks,.
review.negativeRemarks: As a world travelor I stay in good hotels and expect perks
review.locationRemarks: Location is excellent

review.title: Business Travelers Spot
review.reviewText: The hotel in the heart of San Francisco and close to everything! It is clean, beautiful, comfortable and has all the emenitites that a business traveler would want.
review.negativeRemarks: No hotel ownded tansportation from the airport.
review.locationRemarks: Heart of San Francisco. Perfect!

review.title: Great time in SF
review.reviewText: The overall experience was one of the best I have had. My girlfriend and I stayed there for three nights during the month of May; the weather was great (for San Francisco), and so were the people! I will always stay at the Four Seasons when I go to SF; there really is nothing else like it.
review.positiveRemarks: You are really made to feel special at this hotel- the hospitality is excellent and the room service is perhaps the best I have experienced.
review.negativeRemarks: There was no complementary coffee (nor coffee maker in the room). Therefore, each day required that I track a cup down locally... not a big deal.
review.locationRemarks: I love San Francisco (born and raised), but the city has changed a lot over the past 20 years... staying at the hotel made me feel comfortable there.
review.userLocation: La Jolla, San Diego, CA, USA

review.title: Bad hotel
review.reviewText: This is the worst four season hotel I have ever stayed. Over charged my credit card and take forever to refund me!

review.title: 10th Anniversary Weekend
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed for a long weekend to celebrate our 10th anniversary and we had a great time. The hotel and the rooms are beautiful and the service is excellent. Great turn-down service, they even fill the ice bucket for you. Parking is very pricey and hard to get to, but that goes for pretty much anywhere in San Francisco. Everything else was perfect. Union Square, Yerba Buena gardens, and lots of great restaurants and shopping are within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: Our bedroom was the best part. Big, comfy bed, great chairs, good desk, lovely bathroom with tub and shower, huge windows, great view, DVD player.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking is hard to find until you get used to it, and it's expensive. The amount they mention online is just the valet charge, total cost is more
review.locationRemarks: A block from lots of shopping, Union Square, plenty of public transit, Yerba Buena gardens, cool restaurants.

review.title: Four Seasons earns their stars
review.reviewText: The hotel has a very understated air about it....The staff is very accommodating and helpful, and they make every guest feel as if they are special. The only downside is that you have to take two elevators to get to your room.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators
review.locationRemarks: Market Street. Great, central location.

review.title: Great place to stay in the financial district
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel from top to bottom. Staff was great, very friendly and helpful. Room was very nice, clean and comfortable. Great view of the city from our room on the 15th floor. Would definately recommend to anyone. Had two nice meals in the restaurant. Too bad the bar was being remodeled would love to have had a martini there.

review.title: You Get What You Pay For
review.reviewText: Great service, perfect location, lovely room. Expensive and worth it.

review.title: Great Hotel - sort out US tipping nonesense
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel was a delight but the most distinctive quality was the attention of all the staff to our needs and interests. As "Brits" we eventually figured out the San Francisco tipping rules and adjusted payments accordingly. However, if the US in general and San Francisco in particular could learn to adopt the Japanese system (total embarassment when offered any gratuitous payment), your hotel could aspire to being the best in the world.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff helpfulness and attention to our needs
review.negativeRemarks: Getting to it by car (but once there, immensely helpful valet parking)
review.locationRemarks: Wonderfully central but only if you enjoy driving in central SF or don't need a car.

review.title: Great getaway
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in an excellent location in SF. Very good for shopping and walking to restaurants. It is unfortunate they don't have a pool within the hotel. The lounge could offer more variety on their menu.
review.positiveRemarks: check-in and check out was quite smooth; nice service
review.locationRemarks: great location!!

review.title: Amazing Service, Top-Notch Hotel
review.reviewText: Our family (2 adults and 2 young kids) stayed at the hotel and had a wonderful experience. I stay at a lot of high-end hotels throughout the U.S. and the Four Seasons San Francisco deserves to be in the top ranks. The service was amazing and made our stay very special. We stayed in an Executive Suite, which worked out perfectly for our family. I would highly recommend this hotel. One of the best Four Seasons I have ever stayed in.

photos.caption: Sun rising taken from my bed!

review.title: Great hotel especially for solo travellers
review.reviewText: The hotel is amazing, a tranquil sophisticated oasis from the madness of Market Street. The rooms are very generously sized but it's the staff that make the hotel top class, helpful, friendly and always smiling. Couldn't fault the stay at all!
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was amazing and the staff the best
review.negativeRemarks: Food choices but the restaurant was closed for refurbishment
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of the action!

review.title: Great Get Away
review.reviewText: Great experience well worth the money to stay there, loved the suite
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Right on Market street close to everything we needed

review.title: The Four Seasons feels and is a wonderful hotel.
review.reviewText: The staff was exceptional, room was very nice and set up for us with a made up roll up bed! They provided some free transportation for us allowing us to get to our dinner reservations in style. The fitness center was amazing! The staff there was extremely helpful, you must see that place. I really enjoyed staying there and would recommend it to all.

review.title: highly recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel and service. First time stay there and very impressed

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: We stayed there for a weekend getaway and the hotel was perfect! Couldn't ask for more! They asked for our flight info and obtained our boarding passes online and sent them to our room so we didn't have to do a thing. Plus the hotel was beautiful in a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Didn't have anything
review.locationRemarks: Perfect! Shopping right there. Cable car to Fisherman's Wharf right there. Lots of great Restaurants right there!

review.title: Perfect stay
review.reviewText:
Two entrances to the hotel: one from the back alley way connected to 3rd (convenient if you want to go to the convention center) and one from Market Street. Both entrances bring you to elevators that take you to the lobby. From the lobby you take a separate set of elevators to your guest room. First I didn't like having to take two elevators but having the lobby on the 5th floor of the building is actually quite nice in the way that the lobby feels like a lounge for hotel guests only. In the morning, you can find coffee, tea, mini muffins, and a latte/cappuccino/hot chocolate machine at a self-service bar in the lobby. In the afternoon, they provide lemonade (at least on the day that we checked in).

Service was absolutely phenomenal from check-in to check-out. Our room was cleaned twice a day with towels AND bathrobes changed, and toiletries replaced. Everyone was extremely helpful without being overbearing. I was particularly impressed with the efforts the hotel made to ensure that their guests stayed informed - e.g. a printed card suggested that we leave extra time between 7:30am-9am and 5:30pm-7:30pm catch a cab, and a printout was left under our door detailing upcoming street closures for the Giants parade that scheduled to go right in front of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: price
review.locationRemarks: perfect for shopping

review.title: Four Seasons Five Stars
review.reviewText: Terrific hotel. Great services. Attentive staff. Seasons Restaurant service was also attentive! Food was so-so. Eggs were cold and canadian bacon was rubbery.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't get a taxi.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square.

review.title: They put the lux in luxury!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for our 20th anniversary and were treated like royalty. The staff spoke to us by name and the concierge personnel really know their business. The hotel is neat, clean, comfortable and has an amazing spa and fitness facilities. there is a gentleman named Phillip who is one of several quite talented jewelers in the hotel's jewelry store. Phillip has a keen eye for detail and his pieces are magnificent. The jewels are a must see experience! The Four Seasons Hotel puts the lux in luxury!
review.positiveRemarks: The first class treatment and amenities!
review.locationRemarks: We were withtin walking distance to most of the museums and all of the great shopping! You don't need a car when you stay at the Four Seasons!

review.title: Best Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Excellent hotel and staff. The room was big and the bathroom was very good. Housekeeping did an excellent job as well. Also, good location on Market St. Best health club in the city.

My biggest complain would be having to pay for internet. It is absolutely ridiculous that a hotel that charges these type of room rates charges an additional amount for internet access! SFO is the tech capitol of the U.S. I don't want excuses like "our competitors like the Ritz and St. Regis also charge for internet." If you have status with Starwood you DO NOT pay for internet at the St. Regis. If you have status with Marriott I think you don't pay for internet at their hotels including the Ritz. If you have status at Hilton you don't pay for internet at their hotels including high end Conrads. I stayed in several Conrads in the last 9 months including Hong Kong, Singapore, Bangkok, & Bali and DID NOT pay for internet at any of those hotels because of my status with Hilton. Include free basic high speed internet for all hotel guests. If someone wants to have super high speed internet for video, charge them an extra $10.

The bar/lounge food could use some improvement. The overall appetizer selection is a little too foo foo. Include more local items such as crab cakes, calamari, large shrimp cocktail.

Overall a great hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size, excellent staff, location, excellent health club
review.negativeRemarks: Charge for internet!!!! Bar/Lounge could use some better food selections.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, close to nearly everything.

review.title: 5 Star
review.reviewText:
Overnight parking charge was a surprise. But I guess that's life in the big city!

The lounge is amazing!! Wish it closed a little later ;)

review.title: Wonderful honeymoon!
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was amazing! Upon checking in around 1:30pm they found out it was our honeymoon and immediately moved us to the top floor of the hotel (floor 17) with no questions asked. The room had an amazing view, was large, spacious and incredibly clean! Also, later that evening we received a knock on the door and the hotel brought us chocolate covered strawberries and Prosecco complimentary... what a way to start the trip! The concierge at the hotel (especially Joe) was incredibly helpful.. he gave us some really nice local restaurants and also coordinated comedy show tickets for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel!!! A little expensive but for a special occasion it was wonderful!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff at the hotel was amazing! The concierge was incredibly helpful which made our experience that much better.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from union square and the trolley, a block from the BART and steps away from public transit... great location for getting around the city!

review.title: Great memories are made here.
review.reviewText:
The Best of San Francisco -
Everyone working at the hotel are professional, & yet, personalize their services allowing you to truly relax while enjoying the ambiance.
review.positiveRemarks: The views, Seasons restaurant, the room, & the art .
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Delightful getaway!
review.reviewText: A lovely hotel for a short getaway! Very well located in the city centre, yet quiet and relaxing. The staff was outstanding, and the exercise facility a true delight!
review.negativeRemarks: It's cold in San Francisco in August!
review.locationRemarks: Central, with everything available!

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: We stayed in a suite, the room was white-glove clean, tasteful and fresh decor. the staff was incredible. Concierage is one of the best I have ever dealt with.

review.title: SF Four Seasons
review.reviewText: Our room wasn't ready at 5pm when we checked in. The hotel staff was very courteous and apologetic about the situation.

review.title: Pure Luxury without Pretense
review.reviewText: The staff, from housekeeping to the concierge to the bellman were all outstanding. They were enuinely helpful and kind. The room was comfortable, spacious and well appointed. The bathroom was large and a great layout. The only thing I would change is to add another outlet in the bathroom or a mirror in the bedroom area so two people can get ready more easily. The workout facility was the largest and nicest I have found at any hotel and the lobby Entry and Lounge areas were decorated beautifully. Absolutely loved everything about this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Gorgeous, spacious lobby, rooms, and bathrooms and a workout faculty beyond compare. Friendly and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom could use another outlet or a mirror in the bedroom so two people can get ready more easily.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location in Union Square

review.title: Really dreadful experience
review.reviewText: The worst experience ever, would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Worst location, service, rooms, sport club. Barely 4 stars not 5 stars! Shame on the brand name of four seasons. Massively overpriced.

review.title: Great Hotel in every way!
review.reviewText: Great location , close to everything, cortious staff , clean and comfortable rooms, hotel honored all our special requests.

review.title: Nice but Ouch!
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very nice and central to many stores and restaurants. I think I got a fairly good deal for the nightly rate booking through Expedia. If I were to make reservations directly, I think I would not stay there because of the price. Parking was $58.14 per night including tax and I was not told that in advance.

The restaurant was also very expensive, $64 for 2 omelets and coffee.

When we checked out, there was a $64 charge to our room for a breakfast that we did not consume. It took the front desk guy a while to decide if he was going to take it off or what he should do about the situation. He finally did remove it from the bill.

I would recommend this hotel to people only after they new how much all the extras were going to cost.
review.negativeRemarks: Extras outrageously expensive
review.locationRemarks: Very easy to walk to stores and restaurants.

review.title: SF Downtown
review.reviewText: It was all good, especially the attention afforded us by the manager.
Loved the room, loved the service, loved the convenient location...will definitely stay there again whenever we go back to SF.
review.locationRemarks: Wife loved Chinatown and the shopping, I preferred North Beach and the Italian restaurants. Fisherman's Wharf area was a bit cheesy, but heard some terrific groups playing there.

review.title: Reliable and excellent quality. But food & coffee at the cafe in the gym is not great
review.reviewText: My second stay here and I will use this hotel again.

review.title: Fantastic Four Season's
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Great location. Super customer service. Wonderful experience. Only negative-family friendly pool (at the nearby Marriott) was inconvenient and unpleasant.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful service.
review.reviewText:
You can tell its a 5 star hotel. Super clean, delicious beds, big TV.
It is located about 1 block from Union Square where all the nice stores are and 4 blocks from Chinatown.
Walking distance to almost everything.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Extremely satisfied with the hotel!! nice location too... close to shops and interesting places...

review.title: 5 star hotel with 5 star prices to match,will try something else next time
review.reviewText:
No coffee machine in room
I realize this is a 5 star hotel but paying 60-70 dollars for breakfast was a turn off for my wife and me.
Next time I will look for free or cheaper breakfast or maybe a hotel room with a small kitchen.
Service was great,the staff were wonderful.
It is on Market Street.........not a good street as far as the bums around there.
Next time we'll get a hotel with a better view of the Bay.

review.title: Not exactly what I expected from Four Seasons for the price paid
review.reviewText: Concierge service was lacking at this hotel. A few different requests were either not attempted or were attempted but either not completed or not accurate. The response when questioned about a couple of these incidents was not very customer service oriented and that was disappointing. The other times we have stayed at the Four Seasons the staff has beant over backwards to OFFER things to us. This hotel it was hard to make everyday things like catching cabs, renting a car and chilling a bottle of champagne happen. :o(

review.title: All in all, not a bad hotel
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, great location, fantastic view, but I'd trade those unused robes and slippers for a coffeemaker. Having to shower and dress before my first cup is just rude!

review.title: Luxury - not sophisticated - Hotel
review.reviewText: While the amenities (Sports Club LA) and the location make it worth recommending this hotel... the decor, service and layout leaves a LOT to be desired. The decor is minimal and borderline bleak - less opulent than other Four Seasons Hotels. The service is inconsistent and lacking - you will find yourself stranded without an attendant in site, waiting too long for a cab, and never greeted by the staff which always seems to be preoccupied with something else. And the confusing layout makes it hard to find your way around - the back entrance is on back alleys and the multiple elevators keep you turned and lost on your way back to the room.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Nice Lobby, room and Gym

review.title: % star all round
review.reviewText:
Very good hotel, amazing location and great facilities.
Expensive but you pay for what you get - so worth every penny (or Dollar!)
Made a short shopping break great

review.title: Don't book a "Superior Room" if any chance a girl will stay with you
review.reviewText:
I went up to San Francisco primarily to go on a date with a girl. I booked a Superior Room on Expedia. The room itself was fine enough but you get a lower floor. In my case, I was on the 6th floor which is just one above the check-in lobby. It was the first time I've stayed in any hotel where I looked UP at ventilation shafts and plants. It was embarrassing opening the curtains and that was the view she saw. Probably should have spent the extra bucks to get a better room.

Getting a taxi sucks. Takes a while, although the front door guy does try pretty hard to get you one. They've got one hotel car but good luck trying to book it.

review.title: Perfect location - made my husband's birthday extra special!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at The Four Seasons. The entire staff was gracious and accomodating. We loved the menu in the lounge - we ended up eating dinner in the lounge for three nights of our weeks stay. The gym facilities were awesome - helped us to work off some of the delicious food we had at the hotel. The location is perfect - central to everything there is to do in San Francisco. When checking in I mentioned we were celebrating my husband's birthday. On the night before his birthday they sent an incredible birthday desert to our room - a very nice touch to an incredible stay.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: First Time at a Four Seasons - very impessive. Only negative at all was the restaurant - not terrible food, but certainly not up to the standards of the rest of the hotel. Fortunately, there are hundreds of great places to eat very nearby.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, not really 4 seasons standards. Valet, door man and consierge area was the best part. That part of the hotel is down to a science. Rooms are out dated and felt old. Hotel has a old feel to it. Stayed in nicer hotels for half the price.

review.title: FOUR SEASONS IS THE ONLY PLACE TO STAY IN SAN FRANCISCO!
review.reviewText: ok...i'll make this one short and sweet. It was clearly one of the best hotel stays I've ever had. Please keep in mind, I am in sales and spend about 2 weeks per month in hotels. Basically the Four Seasons is able to provide a very sophisticated, 4 diamond hotel, without the arrogance you get at some hotels in that price range. Everyone from the doorman to the folks that cleaned our room, were attentative to our needs, very friendly, down to earth and just overwhelmingly concerned that we have a great stay in San Francisco. We can't wait to go back. And concierges there is over the top. They kept our nights scheduled with everything from comedy show to concert tickets and arranged all of our dinner reservations. It was the most relaxing property we've every stayed at and keep in mind my boyfriend has been in the hotel/restaurant management business for over 30 years, so he is not easy to impress. Yes, it is a bit pricy, but the decor, food, service, location and hospitatlity made it totally worth it. And with the price I got on Expedia, it was not near as much as the standard rate would have normally been. They have a customer now for life. If you can go for a day or a week, do not miss this property. You won't want to leave!

review.title: Perfect Location For First Visit To San Francisco
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed staying at the Four Seasons Hotel in San Francisco. The location was perfect for first time visitors . I love to shop so I was estatic about the selection of stores right outside of the hotel's door.

review.title: Great! Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was absolutely gorgeous, the staff extremely helpful. The rooms were very clean. They absolutely know how to make your stay special, every night the bed was turned down with Christmas music playing softly in the background. I would definately tell everyone to stay at the Four Seasons.

review.title: Second Honeymoon 33 years later
review.reviewText:
Everything possible with this hotel.
Friendly, happy place.
We will return

review.title: Great Pick
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Four Seasons for four nights in November. The hotel is in a great location, and has all the amenities we required, including one of the biggest and best gyms I have ever had the pleasure of working out in. The food at the bar was lovely, and the service was great (but not perfect). Note: If you ask for a room with a view, make sure you specify that the "view" you want is not of the air conditioning vents. Ugly! Aside from that - everything was up to par.

review.title: Four Seasons San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a deluxe property of an elite hotel organization. Nothing is left to chance. It was a memorable experience.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: As well as expected.... Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Excellent experience. best hotel ever!!
review.reviewText: our room was at the corner, which gave us a great view of the city(three sides of our room are whole glass window) the rug is so cozy that you dont really wanna wear slipper. the bed,the pillow, and the sheet were sooooo comfortable. the bathroom has two doors. nice towel and l'occitane products!(i love it so much that i went the store buy those products) i have stayed at so many luxurious hotel and i must say this one is so far the best experience i have ever had!

review.title: very impressive
review.reviewText: excellent location for everything, friendly staff, great holiday experience
